Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph

package fr.cnrs.iees.graph

The core interfaces of the omugi library: graph, node, edge, etc. All the interfaces here match to a precise concept. We have tried to isolate as much as possible the relevant operations into each interface, so that more elaborate concepts can be build by simply aggregating lower-level interfaces (multiple inheritance with no overlap in operations).

The mathematical definition of a graph associates a set of nodes (NodeSet interface) with a set of edges (EdgeSet). The Graph interface inherits from both. Graphs can be directed or not, hence the Direction enum class.

Node and Edge are both Connected objects and hence share some common behaviours: connection, disconnection, retrieval of neighbour objects in the graph. For implementations to work, they also have to be uniquely identified over the graph (Identity interface), and various methods from the Textable interface are used to display their content as text. These features are found in the Element interface and its default abstract implementation, ElementAdapter, that we recommend to use to write implementations of Node and Edge.

A useful particular type of graph is the tree, where edges only reduce to one type representing a parent-child relation. The Tree and TreeNode interfaces propose a simplification of the graph concept where edges are ignored because implicit.

The issue of the responsibility of Node and Edge instantiation (at the graph or at its components level) has been solved by defining factories: NodeFactory, EdgeFactory, and GraphFactory. These classes manage the creation of nodes and edges and the graphs they possibly belong to.

Finally, as graphs are commonly used to store data, the ReadOnlyDataHolder and DataHolder interfaces are provided to allow the storage of any kind of attributes into nodes and edges (cf. the au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.graph.property and au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.collections.tables packages).

  • Interface Summary
    Interface
    Description
    Connected<T extends Connected<?>>
    Interface for connected elements that are used to construct a graph, i.e.
    DataHolder
    For all Graph or Tree connected elements that have read-write properties.
    Edge
    Ancestor to all edge classes.
    EdgeFactory
    A factory to create Edges in an appropriate way.
    EdgeSet<E extends Edge>
    The set of edges of a graph.
    Element
    A basic interface for graph elements.
    Graph<N extends Node,​E extends Edge>
    The root interface for graphs.
    Graphable<N extends Node,​E extends Edge>
    An interface for objects that can be transformed into a graph.
    GraphFactory
    A factory to create Edges and Nodes in an appropriate way to populate a Graph.
    Node
    Ancestor to all node classes.
    NodeFactory
    A factory to create Nodes in an appropriate way.
    NodeSet<N extends Node>
    The set of nodes of a graph.
    ReadOnlyDataHolder
    For all Graph or Tree connected elements that have read-only properties.
    Specialized
    An interface for specialisations of Node, TreeNode and Edge that may have a named sub-class (called label).
    Tree<N extends TreeNode>
    The root interface for trees.
    TreeNode
    The node interface to use in Trees.
  • Class Summary
    Class
    Description
    ElementAdapter
    A base implementation of Element with the methods that should be universal in all descendants.

    Description
    Direction
    Directions of edges for directed graphs.
